intro: Securidaca inappendiculata subsp. inappendiculata, commonly known as the African leadplant, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense umbels. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. The species is notable for its medicinal uses in traditional African medicine.
